text: In mathematics, a Multibrot set is the set of numbers in the complex plane that are put into a function multiple times until its absolute value is greater than a specific number. The Multibrot set is a modification of the Mandelbrot set, where its function is: z_{n} = z^{\ \ \ \ \ \, 2}_{n-1} + c , the Multibrot set's function is: z_{n} = z^{\ \ \ \ \ \, d}_{n-1} + c , where d is any number, real or complex. The formula for the Multibrot set can also be used for a Julia set. == References == Category:Fractals
title: Multibrot set
